intro: Sieversia montana f. submultiflora, commonly known as the mountain sieversia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its harsh, mountainous habitat.
